yt: an old method of printing that AS t edh t the y taking the place of the old letter Cf Ye the an old method of printing that AS t t the y taking the place of the old letter thorn Cf Ye the an old method of printing that AS t t the y taking the place of the old letter thorn Cf Ye the
ytterbic: Pertaining to or derived from ytterbium containing ytterbium
ytterbium: A rare element of the boron group sometimes associated with yttrium or other related elements as in euxenite and gadolinite Symbol Yb provisional atomic weight 17
Cf Yttrium Note Ytterbium is associated with other rare elements and probably has not been prepared in a pure state
yttria: The oxide Y2O3 or earth of yttrium
yttric: Pertaining to derived from or containing yttrium
yttriferous: Bearing or containing yttrium or the allied elements as gadolinite is one of the yttriferous minerals
yttrium: A rare metallic element of the boron aluminium group found in gadolinite and other rare minerals and extracted as a dark gray powder Symbol Y Atomic weight 8

Written also ittrium Note Associated with yttrium are certain rare elements as erbium ytterbium samarium etc which are separated in a pure state with great difficulty They are studied by means of their spark or phosphorescent spectra Yttrium is now regarded as probably not a simple element but as a mixture of several substances
yttro-cerite: A mineral of a violet blue color inclining to gray and white It is a hydrous fluoride of cerium yttrium and calcium
yttro-columbite: A tantalate of uranium yttrium and calcium of a brown or black color
yttro-tantalite: A tantalate of uranium yttrium and calcium of a brown or black color
